intro: Arabis conringioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette, and the plant is generally hardy and drought-tolerant.
